The building sandbox game Minecraft from Swedish developer studio Mojang is further upgraded. The “Frostburn” update to version 1.10 for PC and Mac has just been released. In addition to the usual bug-fixing measures, the basic game has been expanded to include polar and desert regions.

Minecraft: Mojang adds new play areas

The developers have simplified the operation of Minecraft with a useful auto-jump option. To do this, the developers have added a new technical block to the game, which can save the structure of surfaces.

Above all, this simplifies the business of map builders who design the environment with the help of redstone tricks. However, the whole thing is limited to players who are admins in creative mode, in which there are no health problems and unlimited resources.
